title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com released a news quiz to test knowledge on recent trending stories in Greater Boston.
The quiz aims to engage readers with local news and boost community connection.
Peter Chianca, general assignment editor since 2019, oversees the quiz feature on Boston.com.

title: ‘Bye Bridget’: Somerville bakery claps back at internet ‘troll’ with a line of merch
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Hearth & Hug Bakery in Somerville launched 'Bye Bridget' merchandise after an online troll criticized their charitable donations.
The bakery donates 10% of sales to charity, including White Bear Area Food Shelf, during a national protest against federal immigration enforcement.
'Bye Bridget' merchandise proceeds will also be donated to charity, continuing the bakery's tradition of supporting various causes.

title: ‘Keep their light on in our world’: Daughter remembers Eastham couple who fell through ice
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Gerard and Kathleen Boucher died after falling through ice at Bee's River in Eastham on February 14.
Their daughter, Katy Boucher, honored them by encouraging community acts of kindness in their memory.
The couple were long-time residents devoted to community service, with funeral services scheduled for February 27-28.

title: 3 fires being investigated as arson in Fitchburg, officials say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Three fires in Fitchburg homes are being investigated as arson, officials confirm they were intentionally set.
Two fires occurred on Feb. 14-15 at a large apartment building on Blossom and Day streets, swiftly controlled by firefighters.
A Feb. 18 fire on Myrtle Avenue displaced seven people; officials do not believe it's related to the apartment fires.

title: Eric Dane, ‘Grey’s Anatomy’ star and ALS awareness advocate, dies at 53
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Eric Dane, 'Grey's Anatomy' star, died from ALS at 53, less than a year after announcing his diagnosis.
Dane, known for roles in 'Grey's Anatomy' and 'Euphoria', became an advocate for ALS awareness after his diagnosis.
He is survived by wife Rebecca Gayheart and daughters Billie and Georgia. His memoir is set for late 2026 release.

title: 4 Mass. State Police troopers charged in death of recruit suspended with pay
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Four Massachusetts State Police members face charges for recruit Enrique Delgado-Garcia's 2024 death during a training exercise.
Lt. Jennifer Penton and Troopers Rodriguez, Montanez, and LaMonte were suspended with pay after duty status hearings.
Lt. Penton faces additional perjury charges for allegedly lying under oath about Delgado-Garcia's concussion symptoms.

title: Braintree police warn public about planned ‘takeover’ at South Shore Plaza
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Braintree police are preparing for a potential 'takeover' at South Shore Plaza, scheduled via social media for Friday evening.
Such events, known as vehicle takeovers, involve blockading streets for activities like car burnouts and can draw large crowds.
Authorities will coordinate with law enforcement partners and monitor the situation, following similar events in Massachusetts last fall.

title: Kendrick Perkins has Celtics as ‘dark horse’ to win title in 2026 — under 1 condition
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kendrick Perkins considers the Celtics a 'dark horse' for the 2026 title if Jayson Tatum returns from injury.
The Celtics, currently 35-19, are second in the Eastern Conference despite losing key players and Tatum's absence.
Perkins praises Jaylen Brown as a top MVP contender, noting his top-five scoring and defensive stats this season.

title: What would it take for the Patriots to land AJ Brown? ESPN analyst cooked up a hypothetical trade.
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: ESPN analyst Seth Walder proposed the Patriots trade draft picks for Eagles receiver AJ Brown, acquiring a 2026 2nd-round pick.
AJ Brown's reported trade value includes a Patriots' 2026 first, third, and sixth-round picks for the star receiver.
Brown has four consecutive 1,000-yard seasons and is under contract through 2029 after a $96 million extension.

title: Why Kyle Pitts could be the Patriots’ top free-agent target
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kyle Pitts caught 88 passes for 928 yards with Atlanta in 2025, earning Second Team All-Pro honors.
The Patriots seek to enhance their offense after losing the Super Bowl, exploring affordable options like Pitts over costly wide receivers.
Pitts could provide New England with a dynamic pass-catching tight end, projected to sign a four-year, $70 million deal.
